[ğ’……](ğ’…….html)[ğ’‡·](ğ’‡·.html)[ğ’‹¾](ğ’‹¾.html) (dun)ek-le-ti dunkelheit ğ“¡ ğ“¡ [ğ“‡°](ğ“‡°.html) darkness  

Middle English -th, -t, from Old English -Ã¾, -t, -Ã¾u, -tu, -Ã¾o, -to â€œ-thâ€, abstract nominal suffix), from Proto-Germanic *-iÃ¾Å, from Proto-Indo-European *-itehâ‚‚. Cognate with Scots -th, West Frisian -te, Dutch -te, Danish -de, Swedish -d, Icelandic -Ã°, -d, Gothic -ğŒ¹ğŒ¸ğŒ° (-iÃ¾a), Latin -itÄs â€œ-ty, -ityâ€. See -ity, -t.  

Used to form nouns from verbs of action:  
        berth, birth, blowth, drawth, flowth, growth, sight, spilth, stealth, theft, weight  

Used to form nouns from adjectives:  
        breadth, coolth, dampth, dearth, depth, filth, health, height/heighth, length, roomth, ruth, strength, troth, truth, sloth/slowth, warmth, wealth, width, wrath, wrength, youth/youngth
